text:

Just a hunch.

text: #GoGreen
author: TimAlberta

text:
“Find religion” = realize it behooves the GOP to scrap the Electoral College

And yes, there are smart Rs who believe it does. 

One state — Texas — keeps the GOP competitive under this system. If/when it turns blue, that’s the ballgame.

Read the nuance of this debate here:
author: TimAlberta

text:
Folks. There's only one way to (plausibly) get rid of the Electoral College. It's called the National Popular Vote Interstate Compact -- and it's not gonna happen unless some red state legislatures find religion. 

I went inside the lobbying campaign here:
author: TimAlberta

text: I'm old enough to remember DC sports fans arguing, with straight faces, that Harper was in the same league as Trout
author: TimAlberta

text: Ted Cruz was on to something in 2016. Fiorina pick came too late for him, but could be a master stroke for Biden early in a crowded, diverse field. Cover twice the ground, mask ideological liabilities, emphasize electability and party unity. Biden-Abrams tag team could be lethal.
author: TimAlberta

text:
Remember when Beto proposed a live-streamed road trip w/ Will Hurd, then launched his Senate bid two weeks later -- nakedly exploiting a "bipartisanship friendship" that didn't exist before said Road Trip?

Manipulating the media is a skill, and O'Rourke has it by the Tundra-full
author: TimAlberta

text:
Voters often gravitate toward labels — particularly labels suggesting big, sweeping changes that fit within their ideological framework—without knowing or supporting the specifics

Saw the same with base Rs and steep safety-net cuts; endorsed in theory, until they saw the details
author: TimAlberta

text:
Note of caution re: polling on items such as Medicare for All, Green New Deal, even Debt-Free College:

3x in Iowa last weekend voters told me they would only support a candidate who offered M4A. 

“So, you want to eliminate private insurance?”

“No no. I want universal coverage”
author: TimAlberta

text: Terrific news, Kasie. Congratulations!!
author: TimAlberta

text:
“I said, 'I promise I'll love you forever if you promise just to come to my dreams so we can make memories together. But he won't talk to me. He just comes to me and he holds me.”

Awful, heart-wrenching story out of Chattanooga.
author: TimAlberta

text: Could reeeeeally do without the outrage from all of these people in my timeline who got into schools their parents went to and scored internships and jobs off their connections.

text: Having just interviewed a couple dozen Iowa Dems across the state—Bernie or Biden the overwhelming first choice— count me among those who appreciate a snapshot-in-time survey reflecting that national trends (Betomania) are not, at this time, moving actual caucus-goers.

author: TimAlberta

text:
Most striking thing in my interview w/ Omar - more than her Obama criticisms - was her embrace of the Tea Party & tactics used on the right.

Ideology aside, she admires how an activist insurgency toppled a party establishment. She wants to replicate it.

https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/03/08/ilhan-omar-dean-phillips-minnesota-democratic-party-225696 …
author: TimAlberta

text: Thanks for coming home and playing your ass off. Much respect. Best of luck to you and your family.
author: TimAlberta

text:
Taking on Obama, #Omar says “We can’t only be upset with Trump... many of the people who came before also had really bad policies. They just were more polished than he was.”

“We don’t want anybody to get away with murder because they are polished.”
author: TimAlberta

text: Great day to read Playbook, which cuts through the noise of last night’s vote:
author: TimAlberta

text:
OMAR says President Trump is “completely insane” and unfit for office.

However, “I think the vice president is more dangerous than the man running the circus. So, impeachment is something that I think might become necessary—but I’m also afraid of it.” https://politi.co/2TB3TiF
author: TimAlberta

text: Wow this @MiamiHerald headline
author: TimAlberta

text:
Phillips: “Suddenly an entire party is being branded by the perspectives of two of its members” (Omar & AOC)

Omar: “I get saddened by some of my freshman colleagues ... What they pay attention to is the rhetoric that says, ‘This is a red-to-blue district, you have to be careful”
author: TimAlberta

text:
Dean Phillips & Ilhan Omar are both freshmen, the first Jew & Muslim to rep neighboring districts in US history

The businessman reps a 50/50 district; the refugee-turned-activist reps a D+26 district

They have *slightly* different visions for the party 

https://politi.co/2TB3TiF
author: TimAlberta

text:
OMAR SPEAKS:

“I am certainly not looking to be comfortable, and I don’t want everyone necessarily to feel comfortable around me,” she tells me. “I’m OK with taking the blows if it means it will ignite conversations that no one was willing to have before.”
author: TimAlberta

text: Sherrod Brown not running is a huge loss, both for his party and for the country. In an era of rapid political realignment, he’s proven that not everything needs to be binary; that dialogues are good and litmus tests are bad. The 2020 conversation is lesser without his voice.
author: TimAlberta
